Welcome to Male's Docker & Kubernetes Note!

date: 14/10/2025

Author: Thanapong Yooyen

I created this blog to review and share everything I've learned from Maximilian Schwarzmuller's Docker and Kubernetes course on Udemy.

What Is Docker?

Docker is a container technology: A toll for creating and managing containers 

.------------------------------------.        .---------------------------------.
|              Container             | <----> |    The same container always    |
'------------------------------------'        |      yields the exact same      |
.------------------------------------.        |    application and execution    |
| A standardized unit of software    |        |   behavior! No mater where or   |
| A package of code and dependencies |        |  by whom it might be executed   |
| to run that code (e..g. NodeJS     |        '---------------------------------'
| code + the NodeJS runtime)         |        .---------------------------------.
|                                    |        | Support for Containers is built |
|                                    |        | into modern operating systems!  |
|                                    |        '---------------------------------'
|                                    |        .---------------------------------.
|                                    |        | Docker simplifies the creation  |
|                                    |        |     and management of such      |
|                                    |        |            containers           |
'------------------------------------'        '---------------------------------'

Why would we want independent, standardized "application packages"?

.---------------------------. .-----------------------------. .----------------------------.
|  Different Development &  | |    Different Development    | | Clashing Tools / Versions  |
|  Production Environments  | |    Environments Within a    | | Between Different Projects |
|                           | |       Team / Company        | |                            |
'---------------------------' '-----------------------------' '----------------------------'                       
.---------------------------. .-----------------------------. .----------------------------.
| We want to build and test | | Every team member           | | When switching between     |
| in exactly (!) the same   | | should have the exactly (!) | | projects, tools used in    |
| environment as we later   | | same environment when       | | project A should not clash |
| run our app in            | | working on the same         | | with tools used in project |
|                           | | project                     | | B                          |
'---------------------------' '-----------------------------' '----------------------------'

The Problems

Environment: The runtimes, languages, frameworks you need for development

.---------------------------.  often not the same   .------------------------.
|   Development Environment | <-------------------> | Production Environment |
'---------------------------'                       '------------------------'
.---------------------------.  often not the same   .-------------------------.
|  Development Environment  | <-------------------> | Development Environment |
|       for Employee A      |                       |     for Employee B      |
'---------------------------'                       '-------------------------'
.----------------------------.  often not the same   .----------------------------.
| Tools & Libraries required | <-------------------> | Tools & Libraries required |
|        for Project A       |                       |       for Project B        |
'----------------------------'                       '----------------------------'

We want Reliability & Reproducible Environments

  • We want to have the exact same environment for development and production -> This ensures that it works exactly as tested
  • It should be easy to share a common development environment / setup with (new) employee and colleagues
  • We don't want to uninstall and re-install local dependencies and runtimes all the time
